title.rendered: Health check-up camp conducted for students of Mission Education centers

content.rendered:
A health check-up camp was organized on the 30 of March 2019 for school children from a school in Telengana. The school serves as a remedial educational centre for Mission Education. 217 school children from the school were benefitted during the program. Many children were found to be anemic and many suffered from skin diseases as well dental problems. The doctors also referred the children to concerned specialist and also prescribed medicines. All the children were provided medicines and weight and height checkup etc were also conducted. An awareness session was conducted on the importance of health and nutrition for the children and roles of parents and teachers in this regard for the proper growth of the children.

Mission Education is a national level programme of Smile Foundation, which is committed to providing basic education and healthcare to underprivileged children.

Smile Foundation is an NGO in India directly benefitting over 750,000 children and their families every year, through more than 350 live welfare projects on education, healthcare, livelihood and women empowerment, in over 1000 remote villages and slums across 25 states of India.
